defs: = ಕಾಡುಸುವರ್ಣಗಡ್ಡೆ.
a kind of plant.
the plant Azanza lampas (= Thespesia lampas, = Hibiscus lampas) of Malvaceae family.
the plant Corchorus olitorius of Tiliaceae family.
any of several species of small, very sour apples (genus Malus), growing wild or cultivated and used for making jellies and preserves; crab apple.
the tree bearing it.
the plant Solanum torvum of Solanaceae family.
its fruit.
an insect, wild variety of mosquito, of the family Culicidae; a wild mosquito.
the plant Pimpinella monoica of Apiaceae family; anise.
the plant Cassia obtusa of Caesalpiniaceae family; wild senna.
a variety in cucumber; a wild cucumber.
its fruit.
the state of being unrefined, premitive; absence of culture or civilisation.
the act or an instance of troubling, vexing; harassment; annoyance.
= ಕಾಡುಹಂಚಿಹುಲ್ಲು.
the grass Aristida hystrix of Poaceae family.
the grass Apluda mutica (= A. aristata) of the same family.
another grass Eragrostis riparia of the same family.
a wild boar or swine (Sus scrofa).
the plant Smilax zeylanica (= S. macrophylla) of Liliaceae family; prickly sarsaparilla.
= ಕಾಡುಹಂಬು.
the plant Gossypium indicum (= G. neglectum) of Malvaceae; wild cotton plant.
cotton obtained from it.
useless talk; idle gossip; tittle-tattle.
the plant Jatropha curcas of Euphorbiaceae family.
its seed.
the plant Baliospermum montanum (= B. axillare, = Croton polyandrus) of the same family; wild croton.
its plant.
the tree Artocarpus hirsuta of Moraceae family; wild-jack.
its fruit; wild-jack fruit.
a remote village lacking in minimum civic amenities.
the plant Toddalia asiatica (= T. aculeata) of Rutaceae family; wild orange.
a vine of Cucurbitaceae family, akin to bitter gourd; wild bitter gourd.
= ಕಾಡುಹಾಗಲ.
the grass Echinochloa colonum (var. frumentaceae) of Poaceae family.
the plant Dregea volubilis (= Marsdenia volubilis) of Asclepiadaceae family.
the tree Madhuca indica (= Bassia latifolia) of Sapotaceae family; Indian butter tree.
another tree, Madhuca longifolia (= Bassia longifolia) of the same family; honey tree.
the creeper Luffa acutangula (var. amara) of Cucurbitaceae family.
its gourd.
the plant Desmodium motorium (= D. gyrans) of Papilionaceae family; telegraph plant.
its fruit.
the plant Dolichos falcatus of Papilionaceae family; wild horse gram.
the bean of that plant.
the plant Vicia faba (= Faba vulgaris) of Papilionaceae; broad bean.
its bean.
the plant Mundulina sericea (= M. suberosa) of Papilionaceae family.
the leguminous twining shrub Clitoria ternatea of Papilionaceae family with blue flowers, the root of which is used as a dieretic and demulcent; butterfly-pea.
the seed of that plant.
the plant Cassia absus of Caesalpiniaceae family.
the plant Ipomoea coccinea of Convolvulaceae family.
the creeper Luffa acutangula (var. amara) of Cucurbitaceae family; bitter luffa.
its gourd; bitter luffa gourd.
= ಕಾಡುಹುರುಳಿ.
the tree Rhododendron nilagiricum of Ericaceae family.
its flower.
the plant Phaseolus adenanthus of Papilionaceae family.
its bean.
the plant Lobelia nicotianaefolia of Companulaceae family; wild tobacco.
its leaf.
the plant Verbascum thapsus of Scrophulariaceae family.
the plant Vernonia cinerea of Asteraceae family.
any work done in a forest.
(fig.) a work done in a rough, unrefined or barbarian manner.
the plant Crinum defixum of Liliaceae family.
its bulb; poison bulb.
the plant Urginia indica (= Scilla indica) of Liliaceae family.
its bulb; white squill.
a thin food made by cooking the flour of jowar, rāgi, etc. in water; gruel.
a small, short-tailed gallinaceous bird (family: Phasianidae); a kind of partridge; quail.
the plant Ocium sanctum of Lamiaceae family.
the plant Ocium canum of the same family.

the main axis of a plant, having nodes and bearing leaves, usu. extending in a direction opposite to that of the root and above the ground, and helping to transport and store food materials; the main stalk; the stem.
an extract of plants got by boiling, for making medicines; a vegetable decoction.
an undomesticated, wild ox.
a wild she-buffalo.
an undomesticated buffalo; a wild bison.
any of the wild deers.
= ಕಾಡೆಮ್ಮೆ.
= ಕಾಡೆಳ್ಳು.
the plant Sesamum indicum of Pedaliaceae family.
its seed.
any valuable thing got from the forest; forest-wealth; any forest product.
the ownership of a forest.
a king or owner of a forest.
a chief of the fowler community.
lion, regarded as the king of wild animals.
the natural beauty of a forest.
rudeness of manners; absence of civility or culture; barbarism.
a wild bison (Bibos gaurus).
a great forest fire; conflagration.
ಕಾಡ್ಕೋಣ.
a remote village lacking in minimum civic amenities.
coarse food for cattle, horses, sheep, etc., as cornstalks, hay, and straw; fodder.
a tax levied on cattle-feed (now obs.).
a man with one eye; a monocular man.
a man deprived of sight; a blind man.
a perforated or broken thing.
the glossy black bird of moderate size; crow.
(dial.) a depositing of a valuable item as security for performance of a contract or payment of a loan; pledge.
a follower of Indian doctrine of atoms, known as 'vaiśeṣika' propounded by the philosopher Kaṇā da.
a thick, heavy stick; a staff.
conspicuously; strikingly; pre-eminently.
an estate passed down by, inheritance from an ancestor to a legal heir; hereditary property.
hereditary right to lands, fees of office, etc.
an old coin of very small value (one-sixty forth of a paṇa, now obs.).
(obs.) a tax levied (on transfer of rights of property hereditarily ?).
something given to show friendship, affection, suport or allegiance.
an old measure of land.
the right of a person for hereditary property as lands, fees of office, etc.
property owned hereditarily.
evenness of both the pans of a weighing scale.
a weight used to to balance both the pans of a weighing scale; equipoise; counterweight.
a person hired to guard a property; a watchman.
(gen.) wealth.
ಕಾಣಿಕಟ್ಟು kāṇi kaṭṭu to balance both the pans of a scale, using the differential weight.
the plant Grangea maderaspatana (= Artemisia maderaspatana) of Asteraceae family.
a man who is eligible, by virtue of his being a member of a family, for a property passed down by heredity.

vision - a) the act or power of seeing with the eye; sense of sight; b) the object seen; c) something supposedly seen by other than normal sight; something perceived in a dream, trance, etc. or supernaturally revealed, as to a prophet; d) the experience of having such a perception or revelation; e) the act or power of anticipating that which will or may happen; anticipation.
something given to show respect, friendship, affection, support, etc.; a present; a gift.
a tribute under feudalism, - a) a tax paid by a vassal to an overlord, king etc.
a general contribution to the society, for a cause etc.
to present a gift to another to show respect, friendship, affection, support, allegiance, etc.
to receive a presentation, gift.
in a feudal system, an official whose duty is to collect tax to be paid to the overlord, king, etc.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಡು.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಡು.
a seller of precious articles.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಳ್.
unevenness, disparity between the two pans of a weighing scale.
a weight used to balance both the pans of a weighing scale; equipoise; counterweight.
= ಕಾಣಿತೂಕ.
= ಕಾಣಿಕಾಱ.
a person who earns a living by farming; esp., one who manages or operates a farm; a farmer.
the state, condition or fact of being invisible; disappearance.
to cause to be seen; to allow to appear; to make visible; to show.
to come to be; to happen; to become.
to cause to come together, meet.
to be seen; to appear; to become visible.
to come or pass in the mind swiftly and suddenly; to be realised for an instant like a flash of light.
to know; to have clear perception or understanding of.

ಕಾಣಿಸಿಕೊಡು kāṇisikoḍu to show; to cause to be shown; 2. to bring (something) to the notice of another or others; 3. to cause to come together, meet. ಕಾಣಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ kāṇisikoḷ to be seen; to appear; to be found; to manifest.
to crop up (as a disease, problem, etc.).
(a boil, erruption etc.) to appear on the skin; to break out.
to meet; to come face to face.
to make something explicit, clear or distinct.
to perceive an object through the sense of the eye.
to perceive mentally; to understand; to logically judge and apprehend.
to see as a vision; to imagine (such as a thing to happen in future or the reality which otherwise not seen or perceived).
to meet a person; to visit; to call on; to receive as a visitor.
to get; to obtain; to secure; to attain.
to become visible or to be seen; to appear.

ಕಂಡವರು kaṇḍavaru (pl.) persons seen (casually); 2. not related persons; unconcerned persons; outsiders; 3. persons who witnessed (an event, etc.); ಕಂಡುಬರು kaṇḍu baru to be seen; to become visible; to appear; 2. to become known; to be perceived or be perceivable; ಕಂಡುಹಿಡಿ kaṇḍu hiḍi to determine after a probe or judicial enquiry; 2. to find out (a lost thing or fact); 3. to discover ( a thing, way, etc.); 4. to design for the first time (as a scientific invention); ಕಂಡೆಗೊಳ್ k aṇḍegoḷto see; to look at; ಕಾಣಬರು kāṇabaru = ಕಂಡುಬರು; ಕಾಣಗೊಡಿಸು kāṇagoḍisu to cause to be seen; 2. to enable to see; ಕಾಣಗೊಡು kāṇagoḍu to allow to be seen; 2. to allow to see; ಕಂಡವರ ಮಕ್ಕಳನ್ನು ಬಾವೀಲಿ ದೂಡಿ ಆಳ ನೋಡು kaṇḍavara makkaḷannu bāvīli dūḍI āḷa nōḍu for one's benefit, employ another on a dangerous job; the barber learns to shave on the orphaṇs face; ಕಾಣೆಅರ್ಜಿ kāṇe arji a petition made to concerned authorities regarding loss, disappearance, theft, etc, of a thing; ಕಾಣೆಯಾಗು kāṇeyāgu to go out of sight; to disappear; to cease to be seen.
the act, process or fact of seeing with the eye; vision.
the fact or an instance of disappearing; disappearance; a going out of sight.
a kind of fish.
ಕಾಣ್ಕೆಮಾಡಿಸು kāṇke māḍisu to cause to meet (as two or more persons); ಕಾಣ್ಕೆಮಾಡು kāṇke māḍu to show; to exhibit; to display.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಡು.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಡು.
= ಕಾಣಿಕೆಗೊಡು.
the range of one's sight.
the extent of one's imagination, perception or revelation.
= ಕಾಣ್ಬಡಿಸು.
the path, way, that is or can be seen.
an opportunity, chance of seeing, imagining, perceiving etc.
to be unable to see the path, way that is ahead or to be taken; to become incompetent in taking up or continuing one's course of action.
to miss or lose one's opportunity, chance of seeing, imagining, realising or perceiving.
to cause to be seen; to allow to appear; to make visible; to show.
the act or power of sensing with the eyes; sight; vision.
the act opr powerof anticipating that which will or may come to be; foresight.
something seen in or as if in a dream or trance, attributed to divine agency.
such an experience.
(gen.) anything that is physically seen; the object of sight.
determination or boldness in facing danger; marked courage; valour.
of, belonging or relating to, Kaṇva, a vedic sage and author of several hymns of Řgvēda or to his school, tradition, etc.
a descendent, follower or a man belonging to the tradition, of the vedic sage Kaṇva.
a phylosophical school of the vedic sage Kaṇva.
a branch or division of Śukla Yajurvēda ascribed to the sage Kaṇva.
the act or an instance of seeing.
the supposed disembodied spirit of a person who was murdered.
a community or caste of people engaged in dealing with catechu, charcoal, etc.
a member of that community or caste.
a blow that causes death; a fatal stroke; a death-blow.
(emotionally) disturbed; perturbed; agitated.
put out of order; disordered.
frightened; scared.
eagerly wishing; anxious; ಕಾತರವಾಗು kātaravāgu to become eaer; to be driven by zeal,enthusiasm.
fearful uncertainty, anxiety, etc.; apprehension; trepidation.
keen desire; eagerness; ardent longing.
a man driven by desire, eagerness or impetuous impulsion.
a man who is scared or frightened.
(dance.) a moving of a foot or feet backwards without lifting off the ground; such a gait.
to become eager, deeply interested (to have, to do, etc.).
to be afraid of; to be apprehensive, perturbed, agitated; to become anxious.
keen desire; eagerness.
the state of being anxious, apprehensive,etc.; anxiety.
fear; panic.
to have or show strong desire, eagerness.
= ಕಾತರತೆ.
[rightly - ಕಾಸರ್ಕ]the tree Strychnos nux-vomica of Loganiaceae family.
its poisonous nut containing strychnine, brucine and other alkaloids; nux-vomica.
= ಕಾತರತೆ.
an axious man; he who is keenly eager.
a man whose actions are characterised by suddennes or rashness, often lacking reasoning.
a man who is greatly disturbed or disquiet in mind.
keen desire; eagerness.
the quality of person who is impetuous, irrational; impetuousness.
the condition or state of being anxious, apprehensive, etc.; anxiety.
keenly eager; desirous; anxious.
perturbed, agitated or disquiet in mind.
to long for; to be keenly desirous of; to be or become anxious.
to be irritated; to be excited to impatience or anger; to be tensed with.
to worry (oneself or within) about.
to be afraid of; to fear; to be scared.
to flow over the bounds (as tears); to overflow.
to frighten; to fill with fear; to scare.
an axious woman; she who is keenly eager.
a woman whose actions are characterised by suddennes or rashness, often lacking reasoning.
a woman who is greatly disturbed or disquiet in mind.
a kind of fish.
= ಕಾತರಿಸು.
fearful uncertainty, anxiety, etc.; apprehension; trepidation.
fear; fright.
keen desire; eagerness; ardent longing.
irritation of the mind; anger.
= ಕಾತಳ.
= ಕಾತರಿಗ.
= ಕಾತರಿಗತನ.
= ಕಾತರಿಸು.
= ಕಾತಳ.
extreme anger; wrath; fury; rage.
the prepared fiber of the husks of coconuts, used to make matting and rope; coir.
a rope or a piece of rope made of this.
a house-wife; the mistress of a house.
(dial.) the rain during the period when the moon is closer to the Pleiades, the third of the twnety seven asterisms.
= ಕಾತರ2.
= ಕಾತರತೆ.
a kind of farm land.
the Goddess Pārvati.
an elderly or middle-aged widow (dressed in red clothes).
a wife of celebrated sage Yājñvalkya.
a middle-aged woman.
a waterfowl with long neck, and gray feathers.
the tree Anthocephalus indicus (= A. cadamba, = Nauclea cadamba) of Rubiaceae family; cadamba tree.
the flower of that tree.
the plant Viburnum hebanthum of Caprifoliaceae family.
its yellow flower.
an arrow.
a spirituous liquor distilled from the flowers of the tree Anthocephalus indicus (cadamba tree).
in gen. any spirituous liquor.
a relatively long fictional prose narrative with a more or less complex plot or pattern of events, about actions, feelings, motives, etc. of a group of characters; a novel.
the type or form of literature represented by such narratives; the novel.
a man who writes novels; a novelist.
a woman who writes novels; a novelist.
a row, long line, of clouds.
Indra, the lord of clouds (hence of rains).
the plant Viburnum hebanthum of Caprifoliaceae family.
its yellow flower.
the plant Mucuna prurita (= M. Puriens) of Papilionaceae family; cat bean plant.
its bean.

a thin, flexible material made usu. in sheets from a pulp prepared from rags, wood or other fibrous material, and used for writing or printing on, for packaging, as wrapping material, structural material, etc.; a paper.
a single sheet or piece of paper.
a written or printed message; a letter.
a card, folded and gummed or not, for writing or printing a message; a letter-card.
a heavy cotton fabric with a piled, velvety surface, ribbed vertically; corduroy.
profoundly tender, passionate affection for another person based on sexual attraction.
a kind of plant.
its bulbous root.
a man as related to a woman, with whom he has a sexual or romantic relationship; a lover.
a man as related to a woman whom he is married to; a husband.
ಕಾದಲಳ್ kādalaḷ= ಕಾದಲೆ2.
to have love for a person of other sex; to love; ಕಾದಲಿಸೆವಡು kādalisevaḍu to be loved.
a game played beating short sticks rhythmically and dancing to that rhythm.
a woman as related to a man with whom she has a sexual or romantic relationship; a lover.
a woman as related with a man whom she is married to; a wife.

love - a) a deep and tender feeling of affection for or attachment or devotion to a person or persons; b) such a devoted feeling for a person of opposite sex with who he or she has a sexual or romantic relationship.
the main stem of a plantain plant.
active, armed fighting with enemy forces.
a hand to hand fighting between two persons.
a fight, struggle or controversy as between two persons, teams or ideas.
to fight actively with enemy forces; to combat.
to fight hand to hand with another.
to fight, struggle with another to uphold one's view, idea or interest.
a man who is inclined to quarrel with another.
a man whose profession is to fight with enemies; a soldier.
a brave fighter, soldier.
the valour, temperment or tendency, of a soldier to fight bravely.
homespun cotton cloth made in India.
a deep and wide trench, usu. filled with water, surrounding the rampart of a fortfied place, as a town or castle; a moat.
a small waterway for the excess rain water in a farm to flow out.
(dial.) the rain during the period when the moon is closer to the Pleiades, the third of the twnety seven asterisms.
to cause to fight; to make two or more persons engage in a war.
to contend with in battle or combat; to war against; to fight with.
a fight between two armed forces; a war.
the act of fighting with another; a fighting of two armed forces.
any of the descendants of Kadru, the mythological mother of serpents.
a kind of snake.
a thick forest by the side of a mountain.
the state of being crowded with, filled with or densed with.
any of the animals living or growing in a forest in its original, natural manner without being domesticated; a wild animal; a beast.
the organ of hearing; the ear.
made of, containing, yielding or having the colour or lustre of, gold; golden.
(dial.) a vine.
its fruit used as vegetable.
(dial.) a play of boys in which one is to jump over another's feet.
the tree Euphoria longana (= Nephelium longana) of Sapindaceae family.
the tree Dalbergia paniculata of Papilionaceae family.
= ಕಾನಗ.
the tree Myristica malabarica of Myristicaceae family; Malbar nutmeg tree.
its hard seed.
(mus.) a mode, in Karnaṭaka system, having all the seven notes in both ascending and discending orders, but having a mutative course while descending, derived from Kharaharapriya.
the plant Curcuma longa of Zingiberaceae family.
its rhizome.
the yellow powder made from this rhizome.
a large tract of land covered with trees and underbush; a forest; woodland.
ಧ್ಯಾನವಿಲ್ಲದವ ಕಾನನಕ್ಕೆ ಹೋದರೇನು dhyānavilladava kānanakke hōdarēnu a person pretending to be a saint can never achieve sainthood even standing in the sanctum sanctorum of a temple.
a building in which a person or persons normally live; a house.
the tree Radermachera xylocarpa (= Stereospermum xylocarpum) of Bigoniaceae family.
a man who wanders, lives in a forest, (as a fowler, huntsman, etc.).
an animal that lives in a forest; a forest animal.
useless talk; idle gossip; tittle-tattle.
one who spoils a forest, as a person clearing the land of forests or trees or fire that consumes the forest.
Śiva, who nipped one head of Brahma.
the portion of a forest that deep and dense with trees and other vegetation.
the state or experience of living in a forest.
= ಕಾನನಾಂತಕ1.
the wild-bat, a fury, nocturnal flying mammal of Chiroptera order, navigating by echolocation, feeds on flesh and blood, and lives in forest.
an ornament for the ear.
= ಕಾನರ್ಕ.
[rightly - ಕಾಸರ್ಕ] the tree Strychnos nux-vomica of Loganiaceae family.
its poisonous nut containing strychnine, brucine and other alkaloids; nux-vomica.
= ಕಾನನ1.
an ornamental tuft of threads, cords, etc. of equal length, of different colours, used to hang loosely from the horns of oxen; a tassel.
= ಕಾನಶಿರಿಕುಚ್ಚು.
a tax levied on the plants brought from a forest.
to become dense; to be or become crowded.
a son of a woman who is not married.
(in the same sense, chiefly referred to - a) Karṇa, the son of Kunti, b) Vyāsa, the son of Satyavati, characters in the epic Mahābhārata).
a son of a whore.
ಕಾನುಕಡಿ kānu kaḍi (said in anger or sarcasticaly) to achieve something that is great or difficult; 'you have done a tremendous job'.
unrefined, coarse or vulgar speech.
a farm, agricultural estate situated close or adjacent to a forest.
the tree Ixora arborea (= I. Parviflora) of Rubiaceae family; jungle geranium.
law - a) all the rules of conduct established and enforced by the authority, legislation or custom of a given community, state or other group b) any one of such rules.
the condition existing when obedience to such rules is general (as in kānūnu mattu suvyavaste).
the branch of knowledge dealing with such rules; jurisprudence.

the system of dispensation of justice as per the llaws of the land (as in 'kānūnannu ninna kaige ettikoḷḷabēḍa); ಕಾನೂನನ್ನು ಕೈಗೆ ತೆಗೆದುಕೊ kanūnannu kaige tegeduko (fig.) to resort to get justice by using force, and not involving the police or judicial system of the state.
a man who is well trained in the law; an expert in advising others in matters of law.
a woman who is well trained in the law; an expert in advising others in matters of law.
a person who has been trained in the law.
as per, in conformity with or obeying the law or laws of the land.
that can be enforced in a court of law.
the quality, condition or an instance of being legal or lawful; legality.
the eligibility (of a case, instance, etc.) being enforceable in a court of law.
not authorised or sanctioned, as by rules; prohibited by law; against the law; unlawful; illicit; illegal.
a man who acts beyond the limits permitted by law; a man engaged in illegal, unlawful activity.
a woman who acts beyond the limits permitted by law; a woman engaged in illegal, unlawful activity.
a marriage performed as per or as acceptable by concerned law of the land, though not as per the religious customs; a civil marriage.
a man who violates the laws or rules thereof.
a woman who violates the laws or rules thereof.
a house; a place.
a sliding box in a table, bureau, chest, etc., that can be drawn out and then pushed back into place; a drawer.
a small rectangualur mould for moulding bricks.
a kind of sweet pancake made of sesame seeds, jaggery.
a person who cheats; a cheat; a swindler; a deceiver; an impostor.
one who praises another usu. unduly.
a man in a royal court whose profession is to praise his master formally or elaboratly; a panegyrist.
= ಕಾಪಟಿಕ - 1.
the quality or an instance of cheating others; a dishonest action; deceit.
a road that is rough, uneven, and tiresome to walk on; a bad path.
(fig.) an illegal, immoral way, manner, etc.
the grass Sorghum nitidum (=Andropogon sorghum) of Poaceae family.
its fragrant root.
an unchaste woman.
(one's guard or protecting system) to be destroyed or broken.
to break another's guard or protecting system.
= ಕಾಪಟಿಕ.
to cause to save, protect from danger, destruction, etc.
to keep another safe from harm or danger; to protect; to guard; to save.
of or relating to the skul.
made of a skull.
of or relating to alms-bowl.
= ಕಾಪಾಲಿಕ.
the entire bony or cartilaginous framework of the head of a human, enclosing and protecting the brain; the skull.
a beggaṛs bowl.
the vine Cucumis utilissimus of Cucurbitaceae family.
a tribe that is notified as backward by the government.
a man belonging to that tribe.
Śiva, who holds a skull and wears a garland of skulls.
the sect of certain Śiva followers who wear garlands of human skulls and use skulls as the vessel for eating and drinking.
= ಕಾಪಾಲಧರ.
a south Indian sect of strong followers of Śiva with tantric connotations, and who carry a skull as a bowl for food.
a follower of that sect.
= ಕಾಪಾಲಿಕ.

(mus.) a mode (more popularly called as Karnāṭaka kāpi), in Karnāṭaka system, having all the seven notes in both ascending and discending orders, but having a mutative course while ascending, derived from Kharaharapriya.
a thing made just like another; imitation of an original; full reproduction or transcription; a copy.
a method of learning alphabets using a book containing models of handwriting.

ಕಾಪಿಮಾಡು kāpi māḍu to copy - a) to make a copy or copies of (a piece of writing, etc.); reproduce; transcribe; b) to make or do something in imitation of (some thing or person); imitate; ಕಾಪಿ ಹೊಡೆ kāpi hoḍe (esp. in school examination) to copy the answers from another's papers or from a book, notes, etc.
(gen.) to copy illegaly or unethically, to imitate.
to engage a guard or guards to watch, protect someone or something.
a man who watches, guards or protects another person or his property, etc.

to keep unto keep safe from harm or danger; to protect; to guard; to save.
to engage a guard or guards to watch, protect someone or something.

(mus.) a mode, in Karnāṭaka system, derived from the main mode Harikāmbhoji.
to cause someone or something to be watched, guarded against damage, danger, attack, pilferage, etc.; to engage someone for that puirpose.
peculiar, particular, belonging, taught, propounded by to sage Kapila the propounder of Sānkhya system of philosophy.
of or related to, derived from the Sānkhya system of philosophy.

one of the six major systems of Hindu philosophy, involving two ultimate, completely distinct, principles of matter and spirit, but not recognising any god or lord, mainly propounded by the sage Kapila of about 500B.C.
a follower of that system.
the orange or yellow brown colour.
the philosophy of Sānkhya system that recognises spirit and nature (or matter) as two eternal principles but does not recognise any god or lord.
a bath taken by using a wet cloth without getting into or pouring on, water or standing under a shower.
any spirituous liquor.
a thick, sweet, syrupy substance that bees make as food from the nectar of flowers and store in honeycombs; honey.
a deity.
(Jain.) the eighth of the sixteen heavens.

the act, fact or an instance of guarding, protecting; protection.
a cermony performed on the seventh day from the day of birth of a baby to protect the baby from possible danger, evil spirits, etc.
a protective wall or hedge around something.
an armlet worn to protect against danger or harm.
the state of being under the custody of another; imprisonment.
a mark made with a lamp black on the chin, cheek or forehead either to protect against evil spirits, bad look, etc or for good luck.
a stuffed scarecrow kept in a rice field to scare birds.

a brave guard; an undaunted watchman.
a forest protected from tree cutters, and in which wild animals are prohibited from being hunted.

to guard; to watch; to patrol.
to save, guard from danger, harm, etc.; to protect.
a check that protects againt injury, loss, mud, soil, etc; a guard-ring, handle-guard of a sword, mud-guard of a vehicle, etc.

a sari of gray colour.
a person who does not believe in God, the Allah; (a gen. term used by muslims for persons of other religions).

(mus.) a mode (more popularly called as Karnāṭaka kāpi), in Karnāṭaka system, having all the seven notes in both ascending and discending orders, but having a mutative course while ascending, derived from the main mode Kharaharapriya.

ಕಾಮನ ಕರಿ kāmana kari the young leaves or flowers of neem tree; ಕಾಮನ ಬಿಲ್ಲು kāmana billu an arc or ring containing the colours of the spectrum in consecutive bands, formed in the sky by the refraction, reflection, and dispersion of light in rain or fog; a rain-bow; ಕಾಮನ ಬಿಲ್ಲು ಬಳ್ಳಿ kāmana billu baḷḷi the creeper Thunbergia mysorensis of Acanthaceae family; rainbow creeper; ಕಾಮನ ಹಬ್ಬ kāmana habba the festival observed on the last full moon-day of the Hindu calendar year; ಕಾಮನ ಹುಣ್ಣಿಮೆ kāmana huṇṇime the last full moon-day of the Hindu calendar year; 2. the festival observed on that day; ಕಾಮನ ಹುಣ್ಣಿವೆ kāmana huṇṇive = ಕಾಮನ ಹುಣ್ಣಿಮೆ; ಕಾಮನ ಹೂ kāmana hū the flower of neem tree; ಕಾಮಕ್ಕೆ ಕಣ್ಣಿಲ್ಲ kāmakke kaṇṇilla lust renders a person blind; love is blind.
